frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the Donald C. Kidder Scrapbooks, 1933-1935 A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. Acc. 2009.327
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2012 &contact;
Processed By

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Two scrapbooks, 1933 and 1935, kept by Donald C. Kidder, a teenage Boy Scout with Troop 13, and later Troop 33, of Minneapolis, Minnesota. The scrapbooks contain many labeled photographs that document camp activities, postcards written by Donald addressed to his mother, miscellaneous pamphlets and clippings, a Star Scout certificate and a First Class Buckskin book, badge awards, newsletters, etc. Also includes some detailed essays by Kidder, relating to his projects.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Donald C. Kidder Scrapbooks, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 07/29/2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and minimally processed in July 2009 by Ute Schechter, Warren E. Burger Archivist, with further rehousing by KelseyKavanaugh, SCRC staff, in September 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Donald C. Kidder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two scrapbooks, 1933 and 1935, kept by Donald C. Kidder, a teenage Boy Scout with Troop 13, and later Troop 33, of Minneapolis, Minnesota. The scrapbooks contain many labeled photographs that document camp activities, postcards written by Donald addressed to his mother, miscellaneous pamphlets and clippings, a Star Scout certificate and a First Class Buckskin book, badge awards, newsletters, etc. Also includes some detailed essays by Kidder, relating to his projects.
